sen.j: 勤行（ごんぎょう）は、精進のこと。
sen.e: Gongyo (devotional exercises) refer ro Virya - Diligence, Zeal.
Gongyo is 'shojin' (virya, devotional exercises) of Buddhism.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: Gongyo is 'shojin' (virya, devotional exercises) of Buddhism.

sen.j: また、宗教儀式のひとつで、定期的に仏像などの本尊の前で、読誦したり礼拝したりすること。
sen.e: In addition, it is one of the religious ceremonies to do Dokuju (Chanting Sutras) or worship regularly in front of honzon (principal image of Buddha) such as Buddha statue.
It is also one of religious ceremonies including regular dokuju (chanting sutras) and prayers for honzon (major statue of a temple) such as statue of Buddha.
sen.cmt: 誤訳に対応しました。わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: It is also one of religious ceremonies including regular dokuju (chanting sutras) and prayers for honzon (major statue of a temple) such as statue of Buddha.

sen.j: 儀式作法は宗派によって違う。
sen.e: The manner of ceremony is different among sects.
The manners of the ceremony are different in each sect.
The manners of the ceremony are different in each sect.
It is Buddhist terminology.
It is a Buddhist term.
It is a Buddhist term.

sen.j: 日蓮正宗や教義の根を同じくする創価学会、正信会、冨士大石寺顕正会では、朝と夕に、「本尊 (日蓮正宗)（ごほんぞん）」と呼ばれる曼荼羅に向かって法華経（方便品(冒頭の十如是まで)と寿量品）の読誦、唱題（題目を唱える）を行う。
sen.e: Nichiren Sho Sect and Soka Gakkai, Shoshinkai (correct faith association) and Fuji Taiseki-ji Kensho-kai which have the same roots of dharma perform Dokuju of Hokke-kyo Sutra (the Lotus Sutra) (Hobenbon [until the opening Junyoze (Buddhism Ten Factors of Life)] and Juryobon) and Shodai (the practice of Nichiren chant) in front of Mandala (a diagram that depicts Buddhist deities according to certain geometric formats and illustrates the Buddhist world view) which is called 'Gohonzon' every morning and evening.

In the Nichirensho sect and the sects originated from the same dharma as the Nichirensho sect including Soka Gakkai, Shoshinkai and Fujitaisekiji Kenshokai, believers every morning and evening chant (called 'dokuju') the opening of Hoben-bon (until Junyoze [ten factors of life]) and Juryo-bon of Hoke-kyo (Saddharmapundariika-sutra, the Lotus Sutra) and chant the important spell of the Nichiren sect (called 'shodai') for a Mandala, the honzon of the Nichirensho sect.
sen.cmt: 用語の統一。読みやすくしました。
sen.e: In the Nichirensho sect and the sects originated from the same dharma as the Nichirensho sect including Soka Gakkai, Shoshinkai and Fujitaisekiji Kenshokai, believers every morning and evening chant (called 'dokuju') the opening of Hoben-bon (until Junyoze [ten factors of life]) and Juryo-bon of Hoke-kyo (Saddharmapundariika-sutra, the Lotus Sutra) and chant the important spell of the Nichiren sect (called 'shodai') for a Mandala, the honzon of the Nichirensho sect.

sen.j: また、総本山や寺院において題目を1時間ひたすら題目を唱える唱題行が行われている。
sen.e: In addition, in Sohonzan (the head temple of a Buddhist sect) and temples, Shodaigyo, the practice of Nichiren chant patiently for one hour, is performed.
Besides, in the head temple of the Nichirensho sect and some temples, the believers perform one of gongyo 'shodai-gyo' in which the believers have to keep chanting the spell for one hour.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: Besides, in the head temple of the Nichirensho sect and some temples, the believers perform one of gongyo 'shodai-gyo' in which the believers have to keep chanting the spell for one hour.

sen.j: 創価学会では朝と晩に勤行として法華経の抜粋と題目を唱える習慣がある。
sen.e: In Soka Gakkai, the abstract of Hokke-kyo Sutra and Nichiren chant are customarily chanted in the morning and at night as Gongyo.
In Soka Gakkai, every morning and night the believers continue a practice of chanting some parts of Hokke-kyo and the spell of the Nichiren sect as a gongyo.
sen.cmt: 用語の統一。わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: In Soka Gakkai, every morning and night the believers continue a practice of chanting some parts of Hokke-kyo and the spell of the Nichiren sect as a gongyo.

sen.j: 以前は「五座三座」と呼ばれ方便（方便品）・自我偈（如来寿量品）を朝は5度、晩は3度唱える形式だった。
sen.e: Previously, it was performed in the style called 'goza sanza' (五座三座) in which members chant hoben (hobenbon) and jigage (Nyoraijuryohon) five times in the morning and three times at night.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。五座三座の定訳不明です。
sen.e: In the past, the believers had chanted hoben (Hoben-bon) and jigage (Nyoraijuryo-bon) five times every morning and three times every night; this practice had been called 'goza, sanza.'
sen.cmt: 用語の統一。わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: In the past, the believers had chanted hoben (Hoben-bon) and jigage (Nyoraijuryo-bon) five times every morning and three times every night; this practice had been called 'goza, sanza.'

sen.j: が、最近海外の会員が増えたことなどから1回に簡略化された。
sen.e: However, recently it has been simplified into one chanting, partly because of the increase of overseas member.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, recently it has been simplified into only one chanting each gongyo due to the increase of overseas members and other problems.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: However, recently it has been simplified into only one chanting each gongyo due to the increase of overseas members and other problems.
